page.title: 11WANSFORD PARISH CHURCH
page.content: Wansford church is very old, part of it dating to Saxon Times. The most recent structural change is that the vestry has been extended. Presently it costs Â£7,000 to run the church for a year. The church is essential to a village as it is a place for the community to meet together. A vicar is a hard working person who works 60 to 70 hours a week and therefore is known by most of the villagers. The congregation is made up of Wansford people as well as those who come from the neighbouring villages,making an average number of 60 each Sunday. Smaller numbers regularly attend the 3 other services during the week. Those who work out of the village do not contribute as much to the village church as the locals, who provide a church choir, two gardeners and two church wardens.
